intro: Microchilus constrictus, commonly known as the narrowleaf microchilus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Microchilus constrictus is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
